titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that the President should continue pursuing the removal of foreign military forces from Angola and should assist the achievement of national reconciliation and early independence in Namibia.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

bill.summary: 6/9/1988--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Senate that the President should: (1) continue to pursue multilateral initiatives aimed at removing all foreign troops and military advisors from Angola; and (2) assist the achievement of national reconciliation and independence in Namibia by urging all parties expected to take part in elections to meet and approve a Constitution which embodies a Bill of Rights and guarantees democratic principles in a multiparty system.
